programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is at Witley recycling centre in Surrey on a mission to stop quality rubbish from being crushed. She intercepts an Edwardian armchair, a dated display cabinet and a costume jewellery collection. With the help of restorer Peter Fournel and screen print artist Zoe Murphy, Sarah hopes to give new life to the old items, but will she harvest any profits by selling them on?

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley is in Suffolk, helping a retired couple from Essex find a new home in a thriving village as close to the county's coast as their £475,000 budget will allow. Ginny also visits a farm during asparagus season, but before she gets to sample some freshly picked vegetables, she first has to learn how to harvest them.

programme.title: A Special School
programme.desc: Dealing with thieves, puberty and love in Britain's biggest special education school.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A detective uncovers a callous, cunning criminal who has been targeting elderly people for years. A homeless musician's guitar is cruelly stolen by a mystery man, and car thieves struggle with a vehicle that seems to be smarter than they are.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Join presenter Jo Coburn as she discusses the latest political news and stories in a conversational format, covering the comings-and-goings from Westminster in the BBC's daily politics programme. Featuring opinions and arguments from all the sides of the political spectrum, the show invites informed and opinionated guests to share their views on the stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Entertaining and educational British quiz show, hosted by Rick Edwards, where 24 regular contestants compete throughout the series to answer tricky questions. But some of the optional answers are designed to be ''impossible'', or at the very least inconsistent with the information given. The participants must avoid selecting these booby trap answer and the best one wins the £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: James Martin discovers why the raspberries grown near Strathmore are a class apart.

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Gethin Jones delivers the ultimate guide to a countryside summer featuring wildlife, food, gardening and outdoor adventure, all brought to you by a selection of favourite faces. In this episode, John Craven guides us through some top spots for birdwatching in the UK, Sean Fletcher shows that we can find nature in the most unlikely of places when he visits a nature trail at Manchester airport, and James Martin cooks up a tasty rustic recipe on the barbecue when he makes veal escalopes with salsa verde.

programme.title: Destination Wild : Japon
programme.desc: Les habitants de l'île d'Hokkaïdo, située tout au nord du Japon, ont appris à vivre avec son climat difficile : un été court et un hiver très rigoureux.

programme.title: Ancient invisible cities
programme.desc: Au Caire, berceau de l'Egypte antique, Michael Scott dévoile l'intérieur et le dessous de la pyramide de Khéops, construite avec une extrême précision il y a 4 500 ans.

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: Flog It! comes from Norwich Cathedral in Norfolk. In the great nave, experts Kate Bateman and David Fletcher pick out some choice items to take to auction. Among them are an enamel-topped silver trinket box and a vintage model car. Paul Martin uncovers the meaning of religious graffiti.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak face more questions.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Cumbria, enjoying one of the most spectacular coastal railway journeys in Britain. In Ulverston, he sets sail in a small craft with a lifelong devotee of Arthur Ransome's Swallows and Amazons. At Barrow-in-Furness, Michael investigates the mountains of scrap left behind as iron ore was turned into ships, trains and railway tracks. From Silecroft, Michael hikes up Black Combe to join a champion endurance athlete as she navigates and runs across the fells. Pressing north, he reaches the delightful Ravenglass and Eskdale heritage railway.

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: Brian Cox, the star of Succession, discusses his life and career with Amol Rajan.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul sails along a much-loved route through the Kyles of Bute to Dunoon, discovering a secret history of WW2 bouncing bombs along the way. From Dunoon and its connections with international singing star Harry Lauder, Paul gets nostalgic about nuclear submarines in the Holy Loch. Here he meets a man with an impressive water-powered organ. Crossing the loch, Paul beats hot steel with a blacksmith whose ancestors have been working Vulcan's forge for six generations. Their work includes the Golden Gates at Benmore gardens, where Paul learns about a sugar daddy who collected art on a scale to rival the Tate collection. On the shores of Loch Long, Paul discovers a Viking connection in the shape of a vintage sailing boat which takes him to scale the heights of the people's mountain - The Cobbler.

programme.title: Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Coverage of the RHS Chelsea Flower Show.

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: State of the Unions

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: At overwhelmed local hospitals, doctors concentrate resources on treating the wounded most likely to survive. The lobby of the Tropicana Hotel looks like a disaster zone strewn with concertgoers seeking shelter. Country music superstar Jason Aldean, his wife and band members are hunkered down in a tour bus now full of bullet holes. As officials seeks answers, the FBI joins the investigation.

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: Country music artist Dee Jay Silver reunites with his infant son, who was in a hotel room with his babysitter on the same floor as the shooter. Many survivors are still searching for closure. For some, the bond they formed that night with strangers is a silver lining, restoring their faith in humanity. For others, activism is a way to channel their grief.

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Testing the three-second-rule - is it safe to eat food off the floor?

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: A young woman arrives at a police station to report that she has been raped. She was attacked by a stranger at a derelict house in the early hours of the morning. The victim agrees to undergo a forensic examination at a Sexual Assault Referral Centre (SARC) to recover potentially critical evidence that could help identify her unknown attacker. A hunt for the unknown attacker ensues. Using a doorbell recording and CCTV footage, the police begin the hunt to bring the perpetrator to justice.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores North Radnorshire and Montgomeryshire. Iolo begins his journey on a beautiful pasture at Tylcau Hill near Llanbister bursting with colour from wildflowers and rare butterflies. Next stop is Dolfor near Newtown, one of the last remaining strongholds for the curlew in Wales. Along the ancient and historic landscapes of the Kerry Ridgeway and Offa's Dyke, he discovers stunning male linnets singing on the gorse. Further north near Welshpool, Iolo finds some lovely old meadows full of colourful orchids and insects. This leg of the journey ends on the Montgomery canal which is a great place for dragonflies.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It's the last quarter-final of the 2023 MasterChef competition.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: This is BBC Two.
